title: Book Excerpt: The Grandest Stage A History of the World Series
description: In his new book, Tyler Kepner digs into the history of the Fall Classic, including a look at unheralded players who stepped up for their teams at exactly the right time.
dc:creator: Tyler Kepner
media:description: Everyone remembers Willie Maysâ€™s catch in center field in Game 1 of the 1954 World Series, but it was Dusty Rhodes, a pinch-hitter, who delivered a game-winning three-run homer in the 10th inning.
